description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.,which contributes to Immunization, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development PCR 2: Protective and learning environment PCR 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 India: Reducing Stunting in Children Under Five Years of Age: a comprehensive evaluation of UNICEF’s strategies and programme performance – India Country Case Study
India 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
India 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
India 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children.

description.narrative: UNICEF helped maintain zero polio cases by supporting communications strategies for polio vaccines, and high quality routine immunization, including the introduction of new vaccines. UNICEF supported the SMNet, mobilizing 2.7 million households in high-risk communities in Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and West-Bengal, ensuring high oral polio vaccine coverage. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: % Children fully immunised as per RI card in SMNet HRAs (Revised indicator No. 3 as of June 2014)
Percentage of children vaccinated with OPV during SIA (HRA)
% HRAs with IEC visibility as per Government/UNICEF guidelines (Revised indicator No. 1 as of June 2014)
% of mothers who could tell at least one benefit of breastfeeding
Transition of Polio Programme and assets completed by 2017 (Revised indicator No. 5 as of June 2014)

actual.value: 2018:UNICEF is progressing with national and state governments on polio transition. For the FY2016 -17, USD 1.53 million was received from the Government of Bihar for SMNet and was fully utilized. USD 1.9 million is approved in Bihar State Health Programme Implementation Plan for FY 2017-18, fund transf
